task_summary: Remove the lid from the pot, place the pot onto the plate, then use the spatula tool to push the pot toward the front edge of the table.

task_long_description.overview: The scene shows a tabletop with a small pot and lid on a brown stove board, a white plate on the black table area, and a spatula tool. The robot first removes the lid from the pot and sets it aside on the stove surface. Next, it grasps the pot and places it onto the plate. Finally, using the spatula as a pushing tool, the robot pushes the pot-plate assembly toward the table’s front edge, ensuring controlled motion and object stability.
preconditions: Pot with removable lid is reachable.
Plate and spatula are visible on the workspace.
Robot gripper is empty at start.
Clear path to plate and front edge.
stepwise_plan: Perceive lid, pot, plate, and spatula.
Approach and grasp the lid, lift and place it on the stove board.
Approach and grasp the pot, lift and place it on the plate.
Detect the spatula and use it to push the pot toward the table front.
success_criteria: Lid is off and placed aside on the stove board.
Pot is centered or reasonably stable on the plate.
Pot has been pushed toward the front edge of the table using the spatula.
No objects topple or fall off the table.
failure_and_recovery: Failed lid grasp: recompute grasp and retry.
Pot slip during place: re-grasp and re-place.
Insufficient push distance: perform an additional push with the spatula.
Object not detected due to occlusion: re-scan and re-approach.
task_long_description.termination: End when the pot rests on the plate near the front edge and the robot has retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: Pot is being handled close to the plate, indicating mid-task transition after lid removal.
frame_3.predicts_next: Placement onto the plate is imminent, followed by tool-based pushing.

task_instruction: Take the lid off the pot, put the pot on the plate, and use the tool to push to pot to the front of the table.

node_specs.description: Perceive specific target objects before manipulation.
Refine pose near the target before grasping.
Generate a grasp pose and store to blackboard.
Execute grasp using a stored pose.
Lift the currently held object to clear obstacles.
Place an object onto a named surface/area.
Back away to a safe distance.
Push target using a specific tool (spatula).
Short stabilization pause at the end of the sequence.

failure_modes: Grasp on pot is shallow causing drop.
Pot not centered on plate leading to tip-over during push.
Push angle incorrect so pot deviates from intended front-direction.
recovery_strategy: Recompute and retry grasp (lid or pot).
Perform additional shorter pushes with updated direction.
Re-scan scene if objects become occluded.
assumptions: “push to pot” interpreted as “push the pot”.
Front of table mapped to direction_deg=180 in the camera frame.
Lid is placed on the stove board area (visible in frames).
The spatula is used as an external tool; explicit tool grasp is abstracted by PushWithTool.

expected_success_criteria: Lid visibly off and away from pot.
Pot resting on plate before push.
Pot-plate moved closer to front edge after push.
Robot ends in a safe, non-contact pose.
